name: 'La Palabra' Online Trivia | 'West Wing' - Season 6 | 10 Questions

questions.text: What was the fruit that rolled down the aisle on the plane and hit Josh in the foot?
questions.explanation:
Orange.

	The orange had "Hoynes up by 9 in Cal" written on it. Josh took the orange back to the press area where it came from and told them that Hoynes was up by more than 9 in California, but they didn't hear it from him.

questions.text: What place did Hoynes' new scandal put Santos?
questions.explanation:
Second place.

	Donna got the press wondering why Hoynes wasn't going to California so when the new sexual harassment scandal came out Donna's name was involved in the story because she was the one that got people asking questions. When Hoynes dropped in the Presidential race, Santos went up to second.

questions.text: Did the Santos' sign the mortgage papers so they would have money to finance the campaign?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	Josh didn't want them to, but the final decision was left up to Helen so they signed the papers. Helen wanted to know if Josh was a notary republic.

questions.text: The reason 'La Palabra' wouldn't endorse Santos is because Santos wouldn't vote on the driver's license bill for immigrants.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Santos wouldn't come out against the bill so Mr. Garcia endorsed Hoynes.

questions.text: Which governor talked about the Santos health care bill after vetoing the immigrant driver's license bill?
questions.explanation:
California.

	Santos set it up so the press would see him with governor of California and yet the governor would never have to endorse Santos.

questions.text: What was the name of the financial assistant that worked for the Santos campaign?
questions.explanation:
Paul Hickman.

	Paul came to California to tell Josh that the Santos campaign was broke and only if they came in second on Super Tuesday could they make it financially.

questions.text: Did Josh offer to sell his house to help finance the Santos campaign?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	When Josh told Santos what he would do, Santos told him he could go to federal prison and Josh said at least then he'd have some place to live.

questions.text: What did Josh say was Santos' chance to come in second in the Democratic race?
options: Better than Hoynes coming in second
questions.explanation:
Pretty small one.

	Josh told Helen this when they were both in his hotel room. Helen thanked him for telling her the truth.

questions.text: What biography did Leo tell Josh he was reading when they talked on the phone?
questions.explanation:
James Madison.

	Leo asked Josh if he knew what James Madison said on his death bed and Josh said, "I think better lying down." Ironically, Josh was lying on his bed at the time he said this.

Yes.

	They were all gathered in the hotel room. Helen and Matt were in the bedroom when Josh pulled them out, took them aside, and told them they won California seconds before it was announced on national television.
